Package com.PDLB.PPE.API.repository

Interface BuildingRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Building,String>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Building,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Building,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Building,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Building,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Building>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Building,String>
@Repository public interface BuildingRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Building,String>
This interface represents the Building repository, which allows us to perform CRUD operations on Building entities in the database.

  • Method Details

    • createBuilding

      @Transactional @Query(value="CALL sp_createBuilding(?1, ?2, ?3, ?4, ?5, ?6, ?7, ?8)", nativeQuery=true) String createBuilding(Boolean isMain, String buildingName, String room, String street, String number, String city, int zipCode, String customerId)
      Creates a new building entity in the database.
      Parameters:
      isMain - Boolean indicating whether the building is the main one.
      buildingName - The name of the building.
      room - The room of the building.
      street - The street of the building.
      number - The building number.
      city - The city where the building is located.
      zipCode - The ZIP code of the building.
      customerId - The ID of the customer associated with the building.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly created building.

    • getAllBuildings

      @Query(value="CALL sp_getAllBuilding(?1, ?2)", nativeQuery=true) ArrayList<Building> getAllBuildings(int offset, int limit)
      Retrieves a list of buildings from the database.
      Parameters:
      offset - The offset for pagination.
      limit - The maximum number of buildings to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Building objects.

    • countAllBuildings

      @Query(value="CALL sp_countAllBuilding", nativeQuery=true) int countAllBuildings()
      Counts all the buildings in the database.
      Returns:
      The total number of buildings.

    • getBuildingById

      @Query(value="CALL sp_getBuildingById(?1)", nativeQuery=true) Building getBuildingById(String id)
      Retrieves a building from the database by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the building to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Building object with the specified ID, or null if not found.

    • getBuildingByAdress

      @Query(value="CALL sp_getBuildingByAdress(?1, ?2, ?3, ?4)", nativeQuery=true) Building getBuildingByAdress(String street, String number, String city, int zipCode)
      Retrieves a building from the database by its address.
      Parameters:
      street - The street of the building.
      number - The building number.
      city - The city where the building is located.
      zipCode - The ZIP code of the building.
      Returns:
      The Building object with the specified address, or null if not found.

    • getBuildingByCustomerId

      @Query(value="CALL sp_getBuildingByCustomerId(?1, ?2, ?3)", nativeQuery=true) ArrayList<Building> getBuildingByCustomerId(String customerId, int offset, int limit)
      Retrieves buildings associated with a specific customer from the database.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The ID of the customer.
      offset - The offset for pagination.
      limit - The maximum number of buildings to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Building objects associated with the specified customer.

    • countBuildingByCustomerId

      @Query(value="CALL sp_countBuildingByCustomerId(?1)", nativeQuery=true) int countBuildingByCustomerId(String customerId)
      Counts the buildings associated with a specific customer.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The ID of the customer.
      Returns:
      The total number of buildings associated with the specified customer.

    • updateBuilding

      @Modifying @Transactional @Query(value="CALL sp_updateBuilding(?1, ?2, ?3, ?4, ?5, ?6, ?7, ?8)", nativeQuery=true) void updateBuilding(String id, Boolean isMain, String buildingName, String room, String street, String number, String city, int zipCode)
      Updates the details of a building in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the building to update.
      isMain - Boolean indicating whether the building is the main one.
      buildingName - The name of the building.
      room - The room of the building.
      street - The street of the building.
      number - The building number.
      city - The city where the building is located.
      zipCode - The ZIP code of the building.

    • deleteBuildingById

      @Modifying @Transactional @Query(value="CALL sp_deleteBuildingById(?1)", nativeQuery=true) void deleteBuildingById(String id)
      Deletes a building from the database by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the building to delete.

    • deleteBuildingByAdress

      @Modifying @Transactional @Query(value="CALL sp_deleteBuildingByAdress(?1, ?2, ?3, ?4)", nativeQuery=true) void deleteBuildingByAdress(String street, String number, String city, int zipCode)
      Deletes a building from the database by its address.
      Parameters:
      street - The street of the building.
      number - The building number.
      city - The city where the building is located.
      zipCode - The ZIP code of the building.
